awd_titl_txt: RUI: A New Switching Mechanism for Reconfigurable           Bus System Architectures and Algorithms
awd_abstract_narration: Lin         This project is investigating a novel parallel processing  technique, shift switching, in reconfigurable bus systems.  The  research has four parts.  The first part classifies and evaluates  shift switches and their inclusion in efficient VLSI  architectures.  The second part develops and analyzes some  efficient reconfigurable bus architectures with shift switches  for such parallel computations as prefix operations, sorting,  list ranking, tree search, and transitive closure.  The third  part investigates application-specific architectures using shift  switches for computer arithmetic, image processing, and computer  vision.  The fourth part investigates the relation between PRAM  models and reconfigurable busses with shift switching.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
